intro: Cassinia vauvilliersii var. rubra, commonly known as the red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its showy, red-orange flower heads that resemble globes, typically appearing in late summer to autumn. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Cassinia vauvilliersii var. rubra is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
